passage_text: I have a BS in biology already and am applying for the ABSN and FNP program at Samuel Merritt. They require you to take the Teas exam, which I am studying for currently. However, apps are due in January and I was planning on taking it in August.

Best Answer: •Pass a traffic laws and sign test. There are 36 questions on the test. You have three chances to pass. There is no time period you must wait between tests, although it would be a good idea to take a little time to study the drivers manual again. I assume you would just have to show your receipt, but I don't know that for sure and the web page doesn't say. Source(s): http://www.dmv.ca.gov/dl/dl_info.htm#two...

However, you may only register for one testing session at a time, and you must wait until the second day following exam administration to register for your next exam. In addition, there is not a lifetime limit to the amount of times that a pre-medical student can take the MCAT Examination.

The process is easy — simply log into your Praxis account and click on your score report. If you do not already have a Praxis account, you must create one in order to view your scores. You will be able to view, print and download your scores for one year from the score report date.

It usually takes about six weeks for the results of a Praxis exam to be posted on their website. Whether you pass or fail depends on the requirements set out by each state. If you do not pass, you can take the test again in one month, up to six times per year.

Each interactive practice test consists of a single set of practice questions, and is available for 90 days from initial use, or up to 10 total uses. There is only one version available for each test title at this time, so each time you take the test, you answer the same questions in the same order.

3 Praxis Strategies and Tips. 1  You do not have to take all three sections of the Praxis I test at the same time. 2  If you think you may have difficulty passing a section, you may want to take that part of the test on its own.

Eight Weeks (before the exam): Ordered a Praxis review book. Below I’ve linked to the 2 books I’ve seen used most often. I used the blue one (because I’m really cheap… it’s 2nd edition) but most of my classmates used the other. Additionally, if you want more practice exams, you could get the Mosby’s book as well.
